subject: p10523725
History: -year-old man with worsening dyspnea on exertion, new A-flutter. Rule out CHF.
Findings: Since the prior radiograph there has been no significant change. There is no focal consolidation, pleural effusion, pneumothorax or pulmonary edema. Cardiomediastinal silhouette is unchanged and notable for tortuous aorta and mild cardiomegaly. Median sternotomy wires are present and intact. Clips are seen in the midline of the thorax. Bony structures are intact.
Impression: No significant change since the prior study and no evidence of overt pulmonary edema.
